text:
The number seven is a natural number that comes after six and before eight. In Roman numerals, it is VII.
Mathematics.
In mathematics, the number seven is an odd number and a prime number.
It is also a Mersenne prime.
Divisibility Rule.
77 is divisible by 7, so the original number 918785 is also divisible by 7.
Pretend formula_1 is the root number and formula_1 is the last digit. Then formula_1 is the whole number.
If the whole number (formula_1) is divisible by 7, formula_1 is also a multiple of 7. And formula_1 also divide 7. That proves formula_1 is divisible seven, since 3 and 6 are both multiples of 3. So formula_1 is also divisible by 7.
